pr_title: GH-2056 more use of getStatement instead of filter

timeline.message:
GH-2056 migrate to hashmap to be able to return the actual statement instead of a new statement in the SingletonIterator

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Ah. Using a HashMap to be able to match and retrieve the original statement, instead of the newly created copy. Clever.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.bodyText: Can we keep the old constructor signature as a (deprecated) overload? Just to keep things backward compatible.
timeline.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText: Actually never mind, I overlooked that this constructor is package-private anyway.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

GH-2056 migrate to hashmap to be able to return the actual statement instead of a new statement in the SingletonIterator

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2056 migrate to hashmap to be able to return the actual statement instead of a new statement in the SingletonIterator

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this change makes a difference for the results. The set of statements that are in iter but not in deprecated is the same unless the pattern used to filter deprecated is different from the pattern used by iter.
The difference is for performance. Now later on in the FilterIteration we can work directly with the hashmap without having to upgrade to a full LinkedHashModel because of a complicated filter operation.
timeline.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText: The test suite appears to agree with you!
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.message:
GH-2056 migrate from iterator to iterable in order to support for-each loops

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

GH-2056 migrate more code to use getStatements instead of filter

Signed-off-by: Håvard Ottestad <hmottestad@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: @jeenbroekstra I'm proposing we move from iterator to iterable because iterable supports for-each loops and is also simpler to convert into a stream.
timeline.author: hmottestad
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -191,14 +191,14 @@ public default boolean remove(Resource subj, URI pred, Value obj, Resource... co
 	 *                  matching any one of these will match. To match statements without an associated context, specify
 	 *                  the value {@code null} and explicitly cast it to type {@code Resource}.
 	 * @return an {@link Iterator} over the statements in this Model that match the specified pattern.
-	 * 
+	 *
 	 * @since 3.2.0
-	 * 
+	 *
 	 * @see #filter(Resource, IRI, Value, Resource...)
 	 */
-	public default Iterator<Statement> getStatements(Resource subject, IRI predicate, Value object,
+	public default Iterable<Statement> getStatements(Resource subject, IRI predicate, Value object,
 			Resource... contexts) {
-		return filter(subject, predicate, object, contexts).iterator();
+		return () -> filter(subject, predicate, object, contexts).iterator();

replies.bodyText: It's a pity that Java didn't introduce a combo interface with both iterable and stream. We can always create our own interface in the future though which extends both and still remain backwards compatible.
replies.author: hmottestad

replies.bodyText:
@jeenbroekstra I'm proposing we move from iterator to iterable because iterable supports for-each loops and is also simpler to convert into a stream.

I'm fine with that, but can you make sure you update the original issue's (#2030) description, and also the javadoc in Model?
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/core/model/src/main/java/org/eclipse/rdf4j/model/Model.java b/core/model/src/main/java/org/eclipse/rdf4j/model/Model.java
index 240e5e8970..30cdabfee1 100644
--- a/core/model/src/main/java/org/eclipse/rdf4j/model/Model.java
+++ b/core/model/src/main/java/org/eclipse/rdf4j/model/Model.java

@@ -190,7 +190,7 @@ public interface Model extends Set<Statement>, Serializable, NamespaceAware {
 	 *                  disregarding their context. If one or more contexts are specified, statements with a context
 	 *                  matching any one of these will match. To match statements without an associated context, specify
 	 *                  the value {@code null} and explicitly cast it to type {@code Resource}.
-	 * @return an {@link Iterator} over the statements in this Model that match the specified pattern.
+	 * @return an {@link Iterable} over the statements in this Model that match the specified pattern.
 	 *
 	 * @since 3.2.0
 	 *
